text:
Marmeladov slumped at the tavern. 

“Five weeks ago, sir,” he said, eyes glimmering. 

“Everything changed. Katerina Ivanovna and Sonia, oh, mercy! 

They tiptoed around me. ‘Semyon Zakharovitch is tired,’ they whispered. 

They made me coffee, real cream! 

Can you imagine? Eleven roubles and fifty copecks for my outfit. 

Boots, a cotton shirt-front, a magnificent uniform. 

Dinner was soup and salt meat with horseradish. 

Katerina Ivanovna dressed up, looking younger, beautiful. 

Sonia smiled, and I felt like a king.” 

Raskolnikov listened, captivated.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Marmeladov recounts how his recent job success transformed his family's treatment of him, leading to a brief period of care and attention from Katerina Ivanovna and Sonia.
